stream_context.summary: Kaze builds and tests the Boshi quick-draw minigame for “Return to Yoshi’s Island,” including HUD/cut-scene countdown, Boshi’s egg-throw animation, and attaching a cork gun to Mario, while also profiling the game on real N64 hardware and discussing optimization and release concerns.

development_findings.summary: Only three full levels remain; project now in its “last fifth,” though final polish will still take months and roughly 180 stars (≈130 meaningful) are planned.
development_findings.quote: Do you guys actually realize how crazy it is how close we're done to being done… only three levels are missing.

development_findings.summary: Boshi quick-draw minigame: random ‘3-2-1-Fire’ countdown, 280 ms base reaction time, +3 frames leniency per loss; shooting early makes Mario’s gun explode.
development_findings.quote: If you shoot early your gun will blow up in your face… first attempt is 280 ms, then every time you lose you get like three frames more.

development_findings.summary: Implemented cinematic cut-scene: camera on Boshi, then Mario, letterbox framing, music mutes, ‘Fire’ text appears after random delay.
Created Boshi egg throw: decimated model to 0.75, wrote manual math for parabolic toss (no translation tracks in SM64 animation).
Attached cork gun by duplicating Mario’s rig, making all parts invisible except the hand holding the gun—avoids per-frame matrix capture and saves performance.
development_findings.quote: I got the gun to render for free… render an invisible Mario with only the hand visible where the hand is the gun.

development_findings.summary: Engine now runs on real N64 at ~40 FPS before further optimizations; overworld still crashes; proposing triangle culling on large beams in Course 5.
development_findings.quote: Hey! 40 FPS before we even optimized it… The overworld is really wrong right now.

development_findings.summary: Incoming math optimizations: community email with new sine/cos approximation under consideration.
development_findings.quote: Someone just emailed me a new sine and cosine approximation that might actually be worth it.

development_findings.summary: Global save-state detector spawns a ‘space-time Yoshi’ that raps at the player and threatens consequences, to discourage tool-assists.
development_findings.quote: Your save states are rude… If you keep doing it, I'll shut down the console.

development_findings.summary: Future character re-use: defeated Boshi may move to hub and track player reaction times; freed penguins and ‘Boonite’ planned to reappear later for side content.
Technical stance: all optimisation is for real hardware; emulator only needs to keep up.
development_findings.quote: I don’t optimize for emulator at all. I just do for hardware and then the emulator is hopefully good enough.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prefers Blender over 3ds Max for speed, Python scripting, open-source longevity.
context_findings.quote: Blender is fast, 64-bit, has Python, and it's open source, which means it's actually going to be good in 5 years.

context_findings.summary: Cautious about Nintendo DMCA; past strikes removed 70 % of his videos; will likely publish duplicate ‘copyright-free’ trailer and avoid launching near a major Nintendo release.
context_findings.quote: They will absolutely take it down and I will have to release a copyright-free version—that is gonna happen and you know it.

context_findings.summary: No Patreon-exclusive releases; intends Kickstarter for next original game once RTYI ships.
context_findings.quote: I'm not making any Patreon exclusives… I'm gonna bundle it with the ad for my Kickstarter for the game I'm gonna make after I'm done.

context_findings.summary: Emotional beats: excitement at hardware performance, frustration with constant household ‘gates of hell’ noise during stream, and regret over secrecy on collab areas.
Work-life: Zeina babysitting instead of animating; Kaze jokes about having wife bake pizza—lighthearted domestic references.
context_findings.quote: Can you believe Zeina's on babysitting instead of making games with me right now?

biobak.summary: Re-emerges in chat; Kaze notes Biobak usually reviews and improves his models.
biobak.quote: I don't do all the models by myself… after I'm done, we got Biobak looking over it and he makes them a lot better.

zeina.summary: Absent from dev today due to babysitting, highlighting personal/professional balance.
zeina.quote: Zeina's on babysitting instead of making games with me right now.

key_stories.title: Building the Boshi quick-draw
key_stories.summary: Kaze designs a Western-style duel with Boshi requiring reflex shooting. He wrestles with how to present the countdown, camera angles, and fairness across modern displays.
key_stories.challenge: Create an engaging, readable reaction-time minigame on N64 hardware.
key_stories.process: Reviewed Mario Party/Kirby examples, experimented with HUD vs world-space numbers, implemented cut-scenes, calculated human + console lag, set reaction-time curve, added exploding gun penalty.
key_stories.outcome: Functional cut-scene with ‘Fire’ prompt and attached cork gun; further programming of shooting logic slated for next stream.
key_stories.key_quote: You think I'm a scrub? We have to go at least 300 milliseconds on this.

key_stories.title: First full N64 hardware run
key_stories.summary: Kaze boots the current build on real hardware to gauge performance.
key_stories.challenge: Verify stability and frame-rate on the original console.
key_stories.process: Loaded several areas; measured ~40 FPS; discovered overworld crash; identified heavy beams in Course 5 that could be culled.
key_stories.outcome: Confidence in engine speed; new task to debug overworld and add culling optimisation.
key_stories.key_quote: 40 FPS before we even optimized it… The overworld is really wrong right now.

key_stories.title: DMCA scars and future release strategy
key_stories.summary: Kaze recounts prior Nintendo takedowns and plans how to mitigate future strikes.
key_stories.challenge: Avoid losing visibility or having RTYI removed at launch.
key_stories.process: Showed satire video replacing Nintendo assets; plans dual-upload trailers and timing release away from big Nintendo launches.
key_stories.outcome: Documented cautious but proactive marketing approach.
key_stories.key_quote: Had Nintendo not interfered, I would have a million subs by now.
